channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Mechanical and structural analysis of graphene-PMMA laminate
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 17 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66215-8

Mechanical and structural analysis of graphene-PMMA laminate
item.dc:title: Mechanical and structural analysis of graphene-PMMA laminate
item.dc:creator: Anirban Kundu
Won Kyung Seong
S. Kamal Jalali
Nicola M. Pugno
Rodney S. Ruoff

item.title: Plasmonic Ni-doped W<sub>18</sub>O<sub>49</sub> with dual active sites drives efficient methanol dehydration to dimethyl ether
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 17 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-65040-3

This study introduces Ni-doped W18O49 nanowires that integrate low-coordinated W and Ni dual active sites with surface plasmon resonance, facilitating solar-driven methanol dehydration for efficient dimethyl ether generation.
item.dc:title: Plasmonic Ni-doped W<sub>18</sub>O<sub>49</sub> with dual active sites drives efficient methanol dehydration to dimethyl ether
item.dc:creator: Dehua Tian
Yinlan Liang
Zhaoke Zheng
Liang Mao
Xiaoyan Cai

Xiangxian Wang
